channel.title: Star Wars EP VII opens Dec 18 2015
channel.description:
[quote] STAR WARS: EPISODE VII TO OPEN DECEMBER 18, 2015 November 07, 2013 With pre-production in full-swing, a confirmed release date of December 18, 2015, has been set for Lucasfilm's highly anticipated Star Wars: Episode VII.
"We're very excited to share the official 2015 release date for Star Wars: Episode VII, where it will not only anchor the popular holiday filmgoing season but also ensure our extraordinary filmmaking team has the time needed to deliver a sensational picture," said Alan Horn, chairman of The Walt Disney Studios.
Star Wars: Episode VII will be directed by J.J. Abrams (Super 8, Mission: Impossible III, Star Trek) and is being scripted by Abrams and Lawrence Kasdan (Raiders of the Lost Ark, The Empire Strikes Back, Return of the Jedi). Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy, J.J. Abrams, and Bryan Burk are producing, with Tommy Harper (Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol, Jack Ryan, Star Trek Into Darkness) and Jason McGatlin (Tintin, War of the Worlds) serving as executive producers. John Williams is returning to score Star Wars: Episode VII.
Shooting is scheduled to begin spring 2014 at Pinewood Studios.
StarWars.com. All Star Wars, all the time. [/quote] [url]https://starwars.com/news/star-wars-episode-vii-to-open-december-18-2015.html[/url]
As a huge star wars nerd, I had to share this.

item.title: Star Wars EP VII opens Dec 18 2015
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
To be honest, it took about a half hour. I had to find the font, find the background, figure out how to create a random camera shake, how to make the lens flare move, and so on. It’s something I’ve never done before (and, frankly, never will again).

Read full topic

5 minutes?

item.description:
Jack Freeman:

Eh, I’ve never been really interested in Star Wars, but I might keep an eye on this.

Why not? They’re kinda archetypal classics at this point.

item.title: Star Wars EP VII opens Dec 18 2015
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
So, who here is going to try to avoid trailers and other talk on the new Star War movies so that they can watch them clean and fresh in the theaters? I’m going to try to do so.

Also, I moved this to the Ladies Club. This doesn’t necessarily have to do with technology or gaming.

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars EP VII opens Dec 18 2015
item.dc:creator: Keresh
item.description:
The fact that Lawrence Kasdan will be working on the script got me moderately interested.

Maxey:

I am moderately excite. I wonder if they’ll be able to keep Abrams from using lens flares and shaky camera on this one.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tvlP5_lf-hE

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars EP VII opens Dec 18 2015
item.dc:creator: elevenbravo
item.description:
STAR WARS: EPISODE VII TO OPEN DECEMBER 18, 2015
November 07, 2013
With pre-production in full-swing, a confirmed release date of December 18, 2015, has been set for Lucasfilm’s highly anticipated Star Wars: Episode VII.

“We’re very excited to share the official 2015 release date for Star Wars: Episode VII, where it will not only anchor the popular holiday filmgoing season but also ensure our extraordinary filmmaking team has the time needed to deliver a sensational picture,” said Alan Horn, chairman of The Walt Disney Studios.

Star Wars: Episode VII will be directed by J.J. Abrams (Super 8, Mission: Impossible III, Star Trek) and is being scripted by Abrams and Lawrence Kasdan (Raiders of the Lost Ark, The Empire Strikes Back, Return of the Jedi). Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy, J.J. Abrams, and Bryan Burk are producing, with Tommy Harper (Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol, Jack Ryan, Star Trek Into Darkness) and Jason McGatlin (Tintin, War of the Worlds) serving as executive producers. John Williams is returning to score Star Wars: Episode VII.

Shooting is scheduled to begin spring 2014 at Pinewood Studios.

StarWars.com. All Star Wars, all the time.

https://starwars.com/news/star-wars-episode-vii-to-open-december-18-2015.html

As a huge star wars nerd, I had to share this.

Read full topic
